ground_truth: Snape turns and sees Lupin standing in the shadows. Lupin takes the parchment, which now displays a rather unflattering caricature of Snape and a pair of potions. Harry walks aside a fuming Lupin, who grips the map fiercely. Harry walks silently and lingers briefly in the doorway, absently eyeing the waxing moon that glimmers beyond the window, then starts to turn away but stops. Lupin hesitates ever-so-slightly, then returns to his papers. As Trelawney eyes Harry's crystal, Hermione rolls her eyes. Stung, Hermione starts to reply but seems incapable of a single word. Rising gracelessly, she exits, knocking her crystal ball to the floor. Harry watches curiously as the ball rolls slowly out the doorway. Ron stops, glances at Harry, then moves off. Harry watches him go, along with the others, then spies Hermione's crystal ball lying on the landing. Harry sets Hermione's crystal back on its stand and starts to go, when the smoke within the crystal suddenly darkens. Leaning close, Harry watches the shape that appears. It is unmistakable: Sirius Black. Just then, a shadow crawls the glossy surface of the crystal, and a hand snatches Harry's shoulder. He wheels, finds, and Harry stiffens. When it rises, she blinks, eyes the hand that lies upon Harry's shoulder—her hand. Harry shakes his head. Clearly unsettled by his encounter with Trelawney, Harry hastens down the stairs, and we fade out. SWOOK! SWOOK! We fade up on a moving POV of a crow as it glides to the flock circling the feet of a pot-bellied man, the Executioner, sitting in the courtyard. As he sharpens his axe—SWOOK! SWOOK!—we cut to Harry, Ron, and Hermione hurrying past. The Executioner looks up, and we see Harry leading Ron and Hermione toward Hagrid's hut. She and Ron look and see Malfoy, along with Crabbe and Goyle, lurking within a grouping of monolithic menhirs, binoculars in hand, spying on Hagrid, who stands in the pumpkin patch, tossing dead ferrets to Buckbeak. Malfoy stumbles back against a tree, cross-eyed with fear as Hermione jabs the tip of her wand under his nose, when she turns, surprised Ron's spoken to her. Hermione nods, then—SMACK!—quick as lightning, lands a looping right to Malfoy's jaw, putting him flat on his back. Stunned, he leaps to his feet and runs, Crabbe and Goyle huffing and puffing behind. The trio makes their way down the slope and past Buckbeak, chewing on a ferret with idle satisfaction. Hagrid stands by the window watching Buckbeak. Harry and Ron sit, and the trio slips silently into a stand of trees. Beyond them, Hagrid's hut glimmers desolately in the dying sun. High in the clock tower, a bell begins to toll.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Severus Snape, with a characteristic swish of his robes, turns around only to find Remus Lupin quietly standing in the shadows, casting a thoughtful gaze. In a slow, deliberate motion, Lupin takes hold of the old parchment, which has transformed to display an unflattering caricature of Snape alongside a pair of potions. As Harry walks alongside Lupin, who is visibly fuming and gripping the map with a fierce intensity, he bears a silence weighted with thought. Harry, seemingly lost in his own world, lingers for a brief moment in the doorway, his eyes absently drawn to the waxing moon that is shimmering beyond the nearby window. He begins to turn away but hesitates, stopping in his tracks. Lupin, with the slightest moment of hesitation, eventually returns his attention to the papers before him. Meanwhile, as Professor Trelawney peers intently into Harry's crystal ball, Hermione's eyes roll in disbelief. Stung by the situation, Hermione attempts to retort but finds herself unable to utter even a single word. Rising rather gracelessly, she leaves the room, knocking her crystal ball to the floor in the process. Harry watches with a curious glance as the ball rolls slowly out through the doorway. Ron, noticing the event, stops momentarily, throws a glance at Harry, then moves on. As Harry watches Ron and others leave, his eyes catch sight of Hermione's crystal ball lying on the landing. With a considerate gesture, Harry sets Hermione's crystal back onto its stand. Just as he is about to leave, the smoke inside the crystal unexpectedly darkens. Leaning in closer, Harry observes the shape that forms before his eyes, and it is unmistakably Sirius Black. Suddenly, a shadow slides across the glossy surface of the crystal, and a hand abruptly grabs Harry by the shoulder. He wheels around, discovering the source, and stiffens. When the hand rises, she blinks and finds herself staring at her own hand resting on Harry's shoulder—Professor Trelawney's hand. Harry shakes his head in what seems like a bid to clear his thoughts. Clearly unsettled by his encounter and Trelawney's peculiar behavior, Harry hastens down the stairs, and the scene gradually fades out. SWOOK! SWOOK! We fade back in to the moving point of view of a crow, gliding effortlessly to join its flock as they circle around the feet of a pot-bellied man, the Executioner, who is sitting introspectively in the courtyard. As he methodically sharpens his axe—SWOOK! SWOOK!—the scene shifts to show Harry, Ron, and Hermione hurrying past with brisk, purposeful strides. The Executioner glances up, and we witness Harry leading Ron and Hermione with determined steps toward Hagrid's hut. Hermione and Ron pause to look and see Draco Malfoy, accompanied by Crabbe and Goyle, lurking ominously within a cluster of towering monolithic menhirs. Binoculars in hand, they are spying on Hagrid, who stands in his pumpkin patch, tossing dead ferrets to Buckbeak. In a flurry of motion, Malfoy stumbles back against a tree, cross-eyed and filled with fear as Hermione sharply jabs the tip of her wand under his nose. Surprised by Ron's words, she turns, nods, and—SMACK!—as quick as lightning, delivers a powerful looping right punch to Malfoy's jaw, knocking him flat on his back. Stunned and disoriented, Malfoy leaps to his feet and takes flight, with Crabbe and Goyle huffing and puffing as they follow behind him. The trio, unperturbed, makes their way down the gentle slope and moves past Buckbeak, who is lazily chewing on a ferret with satisfied indifference. Watching Buckbeak with a protective eye, Hagrid stands by his window. Harry and Ron take their seats, and the trio quietly slips into a stand of trees, leaving Hagrid's hut to glimmer desolately in the fading light of the dying sun. At that elevated moment, high up in the clock tower, a solemn bell begins to toll, marking the passage of time in the evening air.

Alex strides beside a cheerful Murray, who clutches the chart gently. Alex strolls calmly and pauses momentarily by the staircase, idly observing the crescent sun that flickers past the curtain, then attempts to move away but pauses. Murray falters just slightly, then examines his documents. As Johnson examines Alex's mirror, Rachel raises her eyebrows. Shocked, Rachel attempts to respond but appears devoid of a coherent thought. Rising clumsily, she departs, nudging her mirror orb to the ground. Alex observes intently as the orb meanders slowly out the hallway. Neville pauses, peers at Alex, then drifts away. Alex watches him depart, as do the others, then notices Rachel's mirror orb lying on the corridor. Alex places Rachel's mirror back on its perch and starts to leave, when the mist inside the mirror suddenly deepens. Bending closer, Alex observes the figure that materializes. It is clear: Marcus Grey. Suddenly, a silhouette traverses the dull exterior of the mirror, and a hand grips Alex's arm. He turns, discovers, and Alex freezes. When it ascends, she blinks, examines the hand that rests upon Alex's arm—her hand. Alex shakes his head. Clearly startled by his meeting with Johnson, Alex rushes down the hallway, and we fade out. WHIRR! WHIRR! We fade up on a soaring view of a falcon as it drifts to the flock scurrying around the legs of a slender woman, the Gardener, reclining in the atrium. As she polishes her spade—WHIRR! WHIRR!—we cut to Alex, Neville, and Rachel rushing by. The Gardener glances up, and we observe Alex guiding Neville and Rachel toward Falco's cottage. She and Neville glance and spot Fergus, alongside Cale and Link, hiding among a collection of towering stones, telescopes in hand, observing Falco, who stands in the orchard, tossing live mice to Sunwing. Fergus trips backward into a bush, startled with fright as Rachel prods the tip of her staff under his chin, when she rotates, bewildered that Neville's spoken to her. Rachel agrees, then—WHACK!—swift as a breeze, delivers a sweeping uppercut to Fergus's cheek, dropping him flat on his back. Shocked, he bounds to his feet and dashes, Cale and Link panting and puffing behind. The group navigates their path down the incline and past Sunwing, gnawing on a mouse with calm contentment. Falco stands by the arch watching Sunwing. Alex and Neville settle, and the group slips quietly into a cluster of shrubs. Beyond them, Falco's cottage flickers forlornly in the setting light. High in the church tower, a bell starts to chime.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Snape notices Lupin in the shadows as Lupin examines a parchment showing Snape's caricature. With a tense grip on the map, Lupin walks with Harry, who briefly pauses at a waxing moon but continues on. Trelawney and Hermione have a tense moment, leading Hermione to leave, knocking over her crystal ball. Ron and Harry observe, with Harry placing the ball back on its stand. The smoke inside unexpectedly reveals Sirius Black's image, unsettling Harry when Trelawney's hand surprises him. Disturbed, Harry rushes down the stairs. We shift to see a crow fly to an Executioner sharpening his axe as Harry, Ron, and Hermione hurry by. They spot Malfoy and his cronies spying on Hagrid, who is feeding Buckbeak. Hermione confronts Malfoy and punches him, sending him running with Crabbe and Goyle. The trio retreats past Buckbeak and into trees, observing Hagrid's hut in the fading light as a clock tolls in the distance.
